description: Borrowed from Middle French provoquer, from Old French, from Latin prōvocāre. Doublet of provocate.

verbs.description: provoke (third-person singular simple present provokes, present participle provoking, simple past and past participle provoked)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cause someone to become annoyed or angry.
examples: Don't provoke the dog; it may try to bite you.
To the poet the meaning is what he pleases to make it, what it provokes in his own soul.
